doc.field: - Marine Midland Banks Inc is offering 125 mln dlrs of subordinated capital notes due 1997 yielding 8.66 pct, said lead manager First Boston Corp. The notes have an 8-5/8 pct coupon and were priced at 99.80 to yield 145 basis points more than comparable Treasury securities. Non-callable to maturity, the issue is rated A-3 by Moody's and A by Standard and Poor's. Merrill Lynch and Salomon Brothers co-managed the deal.
